title: Sarong (kain Songket), early 19th century
medium:
Medium: silk, metallic threads
Technique: plain weave with discontinuous supplementary weft patterning (brocade)
description: Brocaded sarong (kain songket) with a maroon silk warp and purple silk weft, brocaded with an all-over repeating leaf pattern in gold thread. Geometric borders brocaded in gold and a wide center band heavily brocaded in gold in the stylized "lawi ayam" or 'cockerel's tail feathers' motif.

tombstone.epitaph:
Sarong (kain Songket), early 19th century.
early 19th century. Medium: silk, metallic threads
Technique: plain weave with discontinuous supplementary weft patterning (brocade). Gift of Edith Wetmore. 1937-8-2.
